description: The US, Japan and South Korea pledged to cooperate more closely on building more resilient supply chains and developing key technologies, including semiconductors and critical minerals.
title: US, Japan, South Korea Pledge Closer Ties on Key Technologies

description: Former French President Francois Hollande indicated he’d be ready to build a new coalition that could govern if elections deliver a hung parliament as a leftist bloc he’s joined struggles to paper over internal divisions.
title: France’s Hollande Mulls Unity Government as His Left-Bloc Creaks

description: When Gery Shalon, mastermind of the infamous JPMorgan hack, flipped, US law enforcement considered it a triumph. But new evidence suggests that while Shalon was working with the FBI, he built a massive new fraud empire in Europe.
title: The FBI’s Star Cooperator May Have Been Running New Scams All Along

description: Thailand’s bid to allow more foreign ownership of condominiums to revive the sluggish property market has triggered an uproar, with critics terming it as an attempt to sell off the country.
title: Thai Plan to Lift Foreign Condo Ownership Cap Triggers Backlash

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, legal affairs reporter Emily Birnbaum outlines the big cases to come from the Supreme Court. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Supreme Court Has Unfinished Business to Settle in Next Few Days

description: Rishi Sunak threw what he could at Keir Starmer in a last-ditch effort to dent the opposition Labour Party’s commanding poll lead in the final televised debate before the UK general election on July 4.
title: Sunak Seeks to Dent Starmer’s Lead in UK Election Debate

description: Bolivian troops led by a senior general stormed the presidential palace on Wednesday as socialist President Luis Arce denounced a coup attempt and called on his supporters to take to the streets to defend democracy.
title: Army Storms Bolivia’s Presidential Palace in Coup Attempt

description: President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum said her predecessor and political mentor won’t direct her administration from afar once she takes office in Mexico, addressing widespread questions about the potential for Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s continued involvement in government affairs.
title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum Downplays Idea That AMLO Would Direct Her From Afar

description: The US Supreme Court is poised to allow abortions in medical emergencies in Idaho according to a copy of the opinion that was briefly posted on the court’s website. Bloomberg Law obtained a copy of the opinion before it was taken down.The Supreme Court’s press office said the opinion in the case had not been officially released. “The Court’s Publications Unit inadvertently and briefly uploaded a document to the Court’s website,” Patricia McCabe, the court’s public information officer.  “The Cour
title: Read the Full Text of Supreme Court Document on Idaho Abortion

description: Israel’s defense minister said talks with top White House officials eased “bottlenecks” in the supply of arms to Israeli forces, a sign that the two sides want to ease tensions fanned by accusations that the US was withholding weapons.
title: US and Israel Ease Weapons ‘Bottlenecks,’ Gallant Says

description: Former Honduran President Juan Orlando Hernandez was sentenced to 45 years in prison after his March conviction for engaging in an 18-year drug-trafficking conspiracy that sent massive amounts of cocaine to the US.
title: Ex-Honduran President Gets 45 Years in US Drug-Trafficking Case

description: The US Supreme Court is poised to allow abortions in medical emergencies in Idaho, according to a copy of an opinion that was briefly posted on the court’s website.
title: Supreme Court Poised to Allow Emergency Abortions in Idaho

description: Organizers of an annual commemoration of the abolition of slavery in the Netherlands withdrew an invitation to the chair of the Dutch Parliament, Martin Bosma, over his far-right views, highlighting how tensions remain high in the country after the electoral victory of the party led by Geert Wilders.
title: Dutch House Speaker Disinvited From Slavery Remembrance Event

description: Keir Starmer and Rishi Sunak. Photographer: Phil Noble/WPA Pool, Oli Scarff/AFP/Getty Images/Getty Images
title: Who Won UK Election Debate? Here Are the Top Takeaways

description: On this episode of Voternomics, former UK diplomat Tom Fletcher discusses how the Labour Party leader’s first 30 days could define his premiership.
title: Major Foreign Policy Tests Await a Starmer Victory

description: Brazil is changing its inflation targeting regime and setting a 3% goal for continuous periods of time instead of a calendar year, a move analysts expect to reduce political noise for the central bank.
title: Lula Cements Brazil Central Bank’s Switch to Continuous CPI Target

description: New York Democrats will field a slate of moderate candidates in critical congressional districts in November, boosting their chances of winning back the House majority despite deep divisions within the party.
title: New York’s Democrats Bet on Moderates Over Leftists to Fight GOP

description: Switzerland’s government has come out against a proposal to cap the country’s population at 10 million, saying it jeopardizes economic growth and security.
title: Switzerland’s Government Says It’s Against a Population Cap

description: The US has repeatedly asked India about an investigation ordered by Prime Minister Narendra Modi after US prosecutors alleged that his government was involved in an overseas assassination plot that targeted an American, a top State Department official said.
title: US Presses India Often About Alleged Murder Plot, Official Says

description: Bogotá scaled back water rationing after more than two months of restrictive measures, saying conservation and recent rainfall have helped replenish reservoirs.
title: Bogotá Pares Back Water Restrictions as Reservoir Levels Recover

description: Kenyan President Bows to Pressure from Protests, scrapping controversial tax plans
title: Kenya's Ruto Scraps $2.3 Billion Tax Plan After Deadly Protests

description: President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva said he hasn’t yet chosen who will take the reins of the central bank next year, adding he will consider Brazil’s needs and not those of financial markets when making such decision.
title: Lula Says Galipolo Qualified But No Decision Yet on Central Bank

description: European Union ambassadors agreed to a new package of sanctions on Belarus as the bloc tries to crack down on Russia’s circumvention of penalties imposed over its invasion of Ukraine.
title: EU Agrees on Belarus Sanctions to Target Russia’s Circumvention

description: President Joe Biden’s campaign already sees one victory from the upcoming debate with Donald Trump — the absence of third-party challenger Robert F. Kennedy Jr. from the stage.
title: Biden Claims an Early Debate Win: RFK Jr.’s Absence From Stage

description: Employers using cheap foreign labor to fill work shortages in Canada are paying more fines for violating the rules of a government program that allows them to temporarily hire employees from outside the country.
title: Fines Issued for Abusing Canada Foreign Labor Program Rise 36%

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business, and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: Emmanuel Macron’s Defeat Would Be a Defeat for Europe

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Starmer's Growing Ambition: Labour Puts A Number On Economic Hopes

description: The European Union marginally revised its proposed tariffs on electric vehicles imported from China after receiving more information from the affected companies, according to a person familiar with the matter who spoke on the condition of anonymity.
title: EU Refines Tariff Rates Set to Hit Electric Vehicles From China

description: Artificial Intelligence will intensify competition abuses by Big Tech, according to Andreas Mundt, the top German antitrust official who’s spearheaded efforts to rein in Silicon Valley.
title: AI Will Fuel Antitrust Fires, Big Tech’s German Nemesis Warns

description: China’s capital city of Beijing eased homebuying requirements for downpayment and mortgages, joining the country’s other mega cities to support the real estate sector.
title: Beijing Becomes Last Mega China City to Ease Housing Rules

description: President Xi Jinping has tapped his former chief of staff to spearhead China’s drive for breakthroughs in core technologies, as tensions with the US ramp up over cutting-edge chips and artificial intelligence.
title: Xi’s Former Chief of Staff Tapped to Push for Tech Breakthroughs

description: European Central Bank policymakers must be ready to handle fallout from political shocks that can occur amid heightened uncertainty, according to Governing Council member Fabio Panetta.
title: Panetta Says ECB Must Be Ready to Handle Any Political Shocks

description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s Conservatives continued their slide in Bloomberg’s UK poll of polls as the betting scandal enveloping the party widens.
title: Tories Slip Further Amid Betting Row, Poll of Polls Show

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Emmanuel Macron Goes From Towering to Toxic in France

description: Israel is facing a legal and political struggle over how many Ultra-Orthodox men should be drafted into the military and how quickly, the result of an historic Supreme Court ruling.
title: Israel’s Order to Draft Ultra-Orthodox Faces Political Maelstrom

description: Julian Assange landed in Australia for the first time in more than a decade, following a guilty plea in a US court that allowed him to return to his home country a free man after serving time in a UK prison and holing up in an Ecuadorian embassy.
title: Assange Lands Back in Australia, Ending Exile After Guilty Plea

description: Kenya’s sovereign dollar bonds are sinking as anti-government protests threaten to derail President William Ruto’s $2.3 billion plan to balance the budget and make the country’s debt sustainable.
title: Kenya’s Dollar Bonds Fall as Protests Threaten Fiscal Plan

description: Mexico’s opposition failed to stop Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s Morena party from keeping hold of the presidency and making massive gains in elections earlier this month. Now the battered and tenuous coalition is facing an even steeper challenge: How to prevent him from approving his controversial slate of sweeping constitutional reforms before leaving office.
title: Battered Mexico Opposition in Disarray as AMLO Pushes for Reform

description: President Joe Biden will issue a proclamation giving mass clemency to US service members convicted of charges under a Cold War-era purge of gay and lesbian people, reversing a decades-long policy of discrimination that forced an estimated 100,000 people from the military.
title: Biden to Pardon US Service Members Convicted Because They Were Gay

description: Dozens of US industry associations urged the White House to help restart stalled talks between East and Gulf coast dockworkers and port operators, saying a strike is the last thing the economy needs amid already strained global supply chains.
title: US Industries Fearing a Port Strike Urge Biden to Revive Talks

description: The South African rand weakened for a third day as traders awaited news on the appointment of a cabinet, almost a month after elections stripped President Cyril Ramaphosa’s party of its parliamentary majority.
title: South African Rand Weakens as Traders Await Cabinet Announcement

description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte will become NATO’s next secretary general, succeeding Jens Stoltenberg who steps down later this year, the military alliance said in a statement.
title: NATO Approves Dutch Leader Rutte to Succeed Stoltenberg

description: The Czech Republic’s main ruling party is taking a political gamble a year before a parliamentary election by pressing ahead with austerity measures that so far have served to bolster support for the populist opposition.
title: Austerity Is Still an Election Winner, Czech Ruling Party Bets

description: Germany’s ruling coalition is seeking to crack down on foreigners who glorify the killing of Israeli civilians or similar acts of terror with updated legislation that would facilitate their expulsion from the country.
title: Germany Cracks Down on Foreigners Who Glorify Terrorist Acts

description: Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally has continued to widen its lead ahead of the first round of France’s snap legislative election on Sunday while President Emmanuel Macron’s Renaissance party and its allies have stalled in third place, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls.
title: Bloomberg French Poll of Polls: Le Pen’s Party Boosts Lead

description: Irish workers have been making the short trip over to the UK to find employment for centuries, escaping famine and more recently the aftermath of the financial crisis.
title: European Job Seekers Turn Away From UK After Brexit

description: China said it will extend its visa-waiver program to citizens from Australia, New Zealand and Poland in the latest sign of closer ties with the countries.
title: China Offers Visa Exemption to Australia, New Zealand and Poland

description: Hong Kong’s education ministry accused students at two schools of singing the national anthem too softly.
title: Hong Kong Inspectors Say Some Pupils Sing National Anthem Too Softly

description: China discovered that officials allowed cash raised from special bonds or funds from the central government budget to be invested in subpar or halted projects, raising questions about the effectiveness of current fiscal measures in bolstering economic recovery.
title: China Reveals Government Fund Misuse, Highlighting Fiscal Risks

description: India’s opposition is gearing up to play a bigger role in the parliament, naming Rahul Gandhi into a key position and fielding its own candidate for speaker of the house in a rare contest for the post.
title: Gandhi Takes Leader of Opposition Role in India’s Parliament

description: Welcome to the Brussels Edition, Bloomberg’s daily briefing on what matters most in the heart of the European Union.
title: Why Emmanuel Macron Would Be Smart to Keep a Low Profile

description: Switzerland’s Alain Berset was elected secretary general of the Council of Europe, a 46-member group that promotes democracy and human rights.
title: Switzerland’s Berset Elected Head of the Council of Europe

description: The French president is complicating the political lives of his supporters by refusing to keep quiet.
title: Even Macron’s Closest Allies Fear His Brand Is Toxic

description: For the full experience visit: England’s Sewage-Infested Waters Spill Into Election Campaign
title: England’s Sewage-Infested Waters Spill Into Election Campaign

description: CNN, which is hosting the first presidential debate on Thursday, has put in place rules that other news outlets say are unusual and restrictive.
title: CNN’s Exclusive Presidential Debate Rules Irk Other TV Networks

description: Vietnam is looking for China’s support with the development of the country’s high-speed railway networks including cross-border lines that would promote trade between the two countries.
title: Vietnam Wants China’s Help for High-Speed Railway Development

description: Singapore has seized S$6 billion ($4.4 billion) linked to criminal and money laundering activities over the past five years, of which about half of these illicit assets were from last year’s record scandal.
title: Singapore Seized $4.4 Billion in Dirty Money Since 2019

description: The latest South China Sea clash saw China’s coast guard wielding axes and a Philippine sailor lose his thumb in an escalation that underscored Beijing’s willingness to see how far it can push Manila — and its allies in Washington.
title: Ax-Wielding Chinese Sailors Raise Stakes in Disputed Seas

description: George Latimer defeated New York Representative Jamaal Bowman in the most expensive congressional primary in US history, a race that exposed the stark divisions within the Democratic Party over the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Latimer Beats Bowman in Pricey NY Primary Shaped by Gaza War

description: For eight years, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau — himself the son of former prime minister, Pierre Trudeau — has managed to keep his Liberal Party in power while navigating his share of drama. But a special election in Toronto on June 24, where a Conservative candidate flipped a seat held by Liberals for more than three decades, shows just how much Trudeau’s party has lost its favor with voters. As the country readies for a national election that’s expected in 2025, Trudeau and the Liber
title: Why Losing One Seat Was Such a Blow for Canada’s Trudeau

description: The Philippines has sent a diplomatic note to China and is eyeing a dialogue with Beijing soon following last week’s clash in the South China Sea, according to Manila’s foreign affairs chief.
title: Philippines Takes Diplomatic Route After Clash With China
